paper_abstract: A set S of vertices of a graph G is an outer-connected dominating set if every vertex not in S is adjacent to some vertex in S and the subgraph induced by Va-S is connected. The outer-connected domination number is the minimum size of such a set. We prove that if delta(G)a parts per thousand yen2 and diam (G)a parts per thousand currency sign2, then , and we study the behavior of under an edge addition.
paper_title: On the outer-connected domination in graphs
